eventType: For college students of any discipline

disclaimer_S1: Each student must carry their college ID with themselves
disclaimer_S2: In case of any disputes, the decision of the event coordinator will be final

rules.rule: The test will have only programming questions
The contest is divided into two rounds,each consisting of 5 questions,each with 2 hours duration
Round 1 will act as a qualification portal for teams to participate in Round 2.
The test will have only programming questions
The team with maximum score and minimum duration wins.
The team with highest score and lowest time wins the event.
Standard marking metric based on time consumed and number of accepted test-cases
Every team must have at least one active Hackerearth ID
Before you attempt programming questions, you should choose a language from the given list
All inputs for the programming problems are from STDIN and output to STDOUT
To understand more about the judging environment, time limits, etc. you can read information about the​ ​HackerEarth judge​
Programming questions have a ​Compile & Run​ option which you can use to run your solution against sample test cases before submitting it
You can submit the solution for a programming problem as many times as you want. For subjective and objective problems, you can change your answer as many times as you want

eventType: Only for First Years and School Students

disclaimer_S1: Each student must carry their college ID with themselves
If found the student is not a first year or school student then they will be disqualified on spot
disclaimer_S2: In case of any disputes, the decision of the event coordinator will be final

rules.rule: One single sprint round, 8 questions in 2 hours
The team with maximum score and minimum duration wins
The test will have only Programming Questions
Marking will occur based on correct test case outputs,within required execution time
Standard marking metric based on time consumed and number of accepted test-cases
Every team must have at least one active Hackerearth ID
Test duration: 2 hrs
Ensure that your email ID is correct
Click ​Submit​ after you answer each question

disclaimer_S1: Each student must carry their college ID with themselves
Participation in this contest will be as a team of maximum two and all the team members MUST be from the same college
disclaimer_S2: Do not try any dishonest or unfair means to move up the rank tables
In case of any disputes, the decision of the event coordinator will be final

rules.rule: The teams will be given 75 minutes to complete the contest
Each team will be given a choice to select any one of the following Computer languages in which they would like to try their mettle

There will be 8 problems in each of the aforesaid languages .The problems will consist of Bug-ridden codes in the respective languages. There can be Syntactical, Logical as well as Runtime Errors in the given codes

The aim of each team should be to provide error - free codes that would align with the problem expectation . Also more credits will be given to the codes with minimum modifications relative to the code given
The team that identifies, corrects all the errors and provides a code with minimum modifications relative to the code given will be awarded the maximum marks
The team with maximum cumulative marks on all the problems will emerge as the Winner
The Problem-Set in all the allowed Languages will be of the same standard to assure Neutrality

disclaimer_S1: Each student must carry their college ID with themselves
Participating contestants should try to maintain formal dress code
disclaimer_S2: In case of any disputes, the decision of the event coordinator will be final

rules.rule: There will be 3 rounds of quiz and each round will eliminate one/more team(s)
The final round of quiz will be contested between 2 final teams
The detailed rules and regulations of each round of the game would be described to the contestants before the beginning of each round
The winning team will be given a prize money of ₹1000/- and the runners-up will be awarded a prize money of ₹500/-

disclaimer_S1: Each student must carry their college ID with themselves
Participating contestants should try to maintain formal dress code
disclaimer_S2: In case of any disputes, the decision of the event coordinator will be final

rules.rule: There will be 3 rounds of debate competition
In the initial round, all the participants will be divided into groups (of less than 8 members) and a Group Discussion will be held

The top participants from the 1st round of the competition, will be selected for the 2nd round of competition, where the debate will be held in form of an extempore. Top 2 participants would be qualified into the 3rd and final round

3rd round will consist of a debate in which each participants would have to defend his or her point of view on a given topic, which will be given at the venue. The participant with the best argument would be declared winner
The winner team would be awarded a prize money ₹1000/-. The runner’s up team would be awarded a prize money ₹500/-

disclaimer_S1: Each student must carry their college ID with themselves
disclaimer_S2: In case of any disputes, the decision of the event coordinator will be final

rules.rule: Photographs will be judged on the following parameters:- Composition, Creativity, Quality of the image
Do not resubmit your photos
Photos must be your own work, if we suspect that the work is not your own it shall be removed with an immediate effect.
Submit your photos for prelims at our photography link on the day before the event.(coming soon)
The theme of finals will be announced at the day of the event.
